bill_title: establish a preference for veterans and disabled persons when leasing residential property owned by counties.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a preference for veterans and disabled persons when leasing residential property owned by counties. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 7-30-14 be amended to read as follows: 7-30-14. If such Any real estate is to be leased for residence residential purposes only, and which does not include the lease of any agricultural or grazing lands, it may be leased on terms of month-to-month leasing by resolution of the county commissioners without public auction or advertising. The resolution of the county commissioners in such cases shall recite shall include the monthly rental of such fee of the property. If any person shall offer offers to pay in advance a monthly rental fee twenty-five percent in excess of the rental then being fee currently paid for such residence the residential property, the county commissioners must shall accept the same offer upon deposit of such the rental fee in advance. However, if the residential property is currently leased to a veteran or a person who is disabled, the county commissioners shall deny the offer. For the purposes of the this section, the term, disabled, means any person who receives or is qualified to receive monetary payments, pursuant to Title II, X, XIV, or XVI of the Social Security Act, as amended to January 1, 2011. Section 2. That § 7-30-10 be amended to read as follows: 7-30-10. The commissioners are authorized to may rent such residential property for residence purposes only for a term not exceeding one year, and subject to the right of sale of the same by the county, and without any guaranty of title and possession by the county, provided the leasing of such property for a term longer than one month has been advertised and the but not to exceed one year. The property shall be advertised and let to the highest bidder at the annual leasing of other county real estate. In such cases the The county commissioners may grant a preference to any veteran or disabled person, as that term is defined in § 7-30-14, when letting the bid. The residential property shall be subject to the right of sale by the county. The rent shall be payable monthly in advance and the commissioners may require security for payment of the same in their discretion. Upon default in rent. If the tenant defaults in the payment of any such rent, the tenant may be evicted under any procedure provided by law for eviction in leases of private property.
